column15: Other common names include False Black Pepper, Vidanga, Nainidang, and Vavding. Memory Improver or otherwise known as White-flowered Embelia (Embelia ribes) is a tropical bush or climbing shrub of usually 20-35 m long and 1-2 m tall. It has purple or red stalks. It is used in Ayurveda medicine. Dried seeds are powdered and used to kill tapeworms. Paste of the berries is used for skin conditions and headache. Leaves are combined with ginger and used as a mouthwash to treat ulcers and sore throats. Bark paste is used to treat pneumonia and other lung diseases. Root infusion is for coughs and diarrhoea. Young leaves and shoots, on the other hand, are edible and usually eaten raw. The fruit has a sour-sweet flavour. It can be eaten raw as well or made into refreshing drink. Young stems are chewed as a delicacy. Crushed fresh bark is used to repel leeches.
